snippet: The museum, which fosters and displays the work of artists of African descent, will construct a new $122 million home designed by the British architect David Adjaye at the site of its current location.
abstract: Studio Museum in Harlem plans $122 million project to construct new home on its current West 125th Street location after realizing renovations would not address demand for more exhibition and educational programming space needed; design by architect David Adjaye meshes with brownstone neighborhood and museum's ambitions to become mainstream.
lead_paragraph: The museum, which fosters and displays the work of artists of African descent, will construct a new $122 million home designed by the British architect David Adjaye at the site of its current location.

headline.main: Studio Museum in Harlem Unveils Design for Expansion
headline.print_headline: Matching a Museum to Its Ambitions
